article:
'Motility' is a biological term which refers to the ability to move
spontaneously and actively, consuming energy in the process. Most animals are
motile but the term applies to unicellular and simple multicellular organisms,
as well as to some mechanisms of fluid flow in multicellular organs, in addition
to animal locomotion. Motile marine animals are commonly called 'free-swimming'.

The opposite of motility is sessility.

Motility may also refer to an organism's ability to move food through its
digestive tract, i.e., peristaltics (gut motility, intestinal motility, etc.). http://emedicine.medscape.com/article/179937-
overview
